content: Subsidiary company of Times Publishing Group **Marshall Cavendish** is a [subsidiary company](/wiki/Subsidiary_company) of [Times Publishing Group](/wiki/Times_Publishing_Group), the printing and publishing subsidiary of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)-based conglomerate [Fraser and Neave](/wiki/Fraser_and_Neave) (which in turn currently owned by [ThaiBev](/wiki/ThaiBev), a Thai beverage company), and at present is a publisher of [books](/wiki/Book), [business directories](/wiki/Business_directories) and [magazines](/wiki/Magazine). ## History Marshall Cavendish was established in the [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom) in 1968 by Norman Marshall and Patrick Cavendish. Times Publishing Group acquired it in 1980. In 2011, [Amazon Publishing](/wiki/Amazon_Publishing) acquired over 450 titles of Marshall Cavendish's US Children's trade books business, Marshall Cavendish Children's Books (MCCB). In 2013, Roger Rosen of [Rosen Publishing](/wiki/Rosen_Publishing) acquired the Marshall Cavendish's US Children's library books business. ## Books - *How It Works* (later reprinted and updated by H. S. Stuttman Co., Inc.for the [US](/wiki/United_States), titled *[The Illustrated Science and Invention Encyclopedia](/wiki/The_Illustrated_Science_and_Invention_Encyclopedia)*) - “Malaysian Murders & Mysteries” by [Martin Vengadesan](/wiki/Martin_Vengadesan) and Andrew Sagayam. ## Magazines, partworks -
